body_html: @apaszke Since adding so many classes just for wrap do looks ugly, a better approach might be to do it in C++ bindings. I've made this change. It is simple, just add py::dynamic_attr() to allow dynamically adding attributes. Doing so can get rid of all the wrapper types.
body_text: @apaszke Since adding so many classes just for wrap do looks ugly, a better approach might be to do it in C++ bindings. I've made this change. It is simple, just add py::dynamic_attr() to allow dynamically adding attributes. Doing so can get rid of all the wrapper types.
body: @apaszke Since adding so many classes just for wrap do looks ugly, a better approach might be to do it in C++ bindings. I've made this change. It is simple, just add `py::dynamic_attr()` to allow dynamically adding attributes. Doing so can get rid of all the wrapper types.
